intro: Paramollugo elliotii, commonly known as Elliot's paramollugo, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
